content: Extension of National Guard authorities to Mayor of the District of Columbia. Extension of National Guard authorities to Mayor of the District of Columbia includes amending sections of the Act to replace references to the "President of the United States" with "Mayor of the District of Columbia." This change applies to the Mayor's role as Commander-in-Chief, the Reserve Corps, and the appointment of commissioned officers. Section 9, 13, 19, and 20 of the Act are amended to replace references to the "President" with "Mayor of the District of Columbia." This change affects the appointment of commissioned officers and the role of the Mayor as Commander-in-Chief. In Section 20 of the Act, references to the "President of the United States" are replaced with "Mayor of the District of Columbia." This change also applies to the retirement process. Additionally, Section 45 is amended to remove references to the United States Marshal, and Section 46 is updated to replace "the President" with "the Mayor." Lastly, in Section 51, "the President of the United States" is changed to "the Mayor of the District of Columbia" in relation to General Courts Martial. SEC. 2.
